channel.title: EasyRSC : Cannot assign requested address: bind
channel.description:
Hey guys, I'm stuck with this : [b][i]Cannot assign requested address: bind[/i][/b] when I start EasyRSC server.
I searched on every post with that error and still got one.
I edited [b]Server.java[/b] with my [b]default gateway[/b] which is 192.168.2.1 I edited [b]Settings.ini[/b] with my [b]External IP[/b] (from www.whatismyip.com)
I Portfowarded. (image below) (Not sure if I put the good IP...) [img]http://img10.imageshack.us/img10/354/80492202.jpg[/img]
On some others posts, people said to kill all java process, which I did and still got the problem.
Another thing I would like to know. In order to people to be able to connect to it, I have to run it from my server I suppose? But why insert my IP? I don't really get that part lol. Anyways Hope you guys can help me a bit!
Thanks.

item.title: EasyRSC : Cannot assign requested address: bind
item.dc:creator: @skee_pee skee pee
item.description:
@skee_pee wrote:

[quote author=adu link=topic=410790.msg3030647#msg3030647 date=1258346099]It will eaither be your default gatway ip that goes in server.java or the ip from whatsmyip.org. /quote]

On most posts, people say to put default gateway on Server.java.

Btw, is it possible to run the server on your own personal computer without the need of a Dedi/Vps? I mean, running it so everyone can connect on it if they have the client…

Read full topic
item.source: EasyRSC : Cannot assign requested address: bind

item.title: EasyRSC : Cannot assign requested address: bind
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“skee pee, post:3, topic:314328”][quote author=adu link=topic=410790.msg3030134#msg3030134 date=1258313711]
You need to be forwarding the ip[ you stick in server.java, try to have 192.168.2.1 in server.java and forward that and if that dosent work do the same for 192.168.2.8.

else, your firewall might be blocking incomming traffic.
[/quote]

Nice, I tried with 192.168.2.8 in my server.java file and the error is gone! The thing is that it works, but only when I run EasyRSC from my own PC. The error is still there when I open EasyRSC from my server… I have to portforward with the server IP?[/quote]

Usually from a dedicated box, you dont need to forward any ports. It will eaither be your default gatway ip that goes in server.java or the ip from whatsmyip.org. Im not sure which one because i havent run easyrsc form a dedi yet.

Read full topic
item.source: EasyRSC : Cannot assign requested address: bind

item.title: EasyRSC : Cannot assign requested address: bind

item.description:
@skee_pee wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:2, topic:314328”]You need to be forwarding the ip[ you stick in server.java, try to have 192.168.2.1 in server.java and forward that and if that dosent work do the same for 192.168.2.8.

else, your firewall might be blocking incomming traffic.[/quote]

Nice, I tried with 192.168.2.8 in my server.java file and the error is gone! The thing is that it works, but only when I run EasyRSC from my own PC. The error is still there when I open EasyRSC from my server… I have to portforward with the server IP?

item.title: EasyRSC : Cannot assign requested address: bind
item.dc:creator: @skee_pee skee pee
item.description:
@skee_pee wrote:

Hey guys, I’m stuck with this : Cannot assign requested address: bind when I start EasyRSC server.

I searched on every post with that error and still got one.

I edited Server.java with my default gateway which is 192.168.2.1
I edited Settings.ini with my External IP (from www.whatismyip.com)

I Portfowarded. (image below) (Not sure if I put the good IP…)

On some others posts, people said to kill all java process, which I did and still got the problem.

Another thing I would like to know. In order to people to be able to connect to it, I have to run it from my server I suppose? But why insert my IP? I don’t really get that part lol. Anyways Hope you guys can help me a bit!

Thanks.
